result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM Defendant Robert J. Harkreader in court.  Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan Sr. in court for Robert J. Harkreader.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Status from Atty Mulligan Sr.-requesting another status-defendant waiting on an evaluation. No objection from the State. Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on January 9, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

1:03 PM Defendant Robert J. Harkreader in court.  Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan Sr. in court for Robert J. Harkreader.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Atty Mulligan makes argument in re: motion to amend bond-requesting a release of bond funds posted to pay for an evaluation. State makes argument-State agreed not to take a position on this issue. Court amends cash bail to $7,500.00. Refund of $2,500 to be issued to the person who posted the bond.
Motion hearing on September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:00 PM Defendant Robert J. Harkreader in court.  Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan Sr. in court for Robert J. Harkreader.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Motion to amended bond for defendant to have contact w/ his son. Atty Mulligan makes argument to the court. Court speaks to the parties. State opposes to the motion to modify bond. State makes argument. Sheri Lindenfelser makes statement to the court-opposes the motion to modify bond. 
Court modifies bond.

Defendant may have supervised contact with his son at a supervised facility. No more than one hour per week. 
No contact w/ any other minors.

2:33 PM Defendant Robert J. Harkreader in court.  Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan Sr. in court for Robert J. Harkreader.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Status from Atty Mulligan-requesting more time. No objection from the state. Set for status. 
Defense had filed a motion for bond modification-schedule hearing. 
Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Motion hearing on July 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:40 AM Defendant Robert J. Harkreader in court.  Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan Sr. appeared by video for Robert J. Harkreader.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Waived formal reading of the information. Not guilty plea is entered.
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:30 PM Defendant, Robert J. Harkreader appeared with Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances. State calls Investigator Tia Hartl to the stand. Clerk swears in. State begins questioning. Objection by Atty Mulligan-Overruled-State continues questioning. Court finds the witness has identified the defendant. State continues. Nothing further.  Cross from Atty Mulligan. Nothing further. Redirect. Recross. Nothing further. Witness excused. Argument from the parties. Court finds probable cause.  Arraignment scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.

10:13 AM Defendant, Robert J. Harkreader appeared with Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Set for preliminary hearing. Waived time limits. 
#715-934-9478 for text reminders.   Bond to continue.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

No contact w/C.J.C 
No contact w/ Minor Children

Defendant appears in custody via video from the Washburn County Jail. Sheila Younk appears for the State. Atty Thomas Mulligan Sr. appears via video for the defendant. Court calls case and appearances. Court finds probable cause. Atty Mulligan speaks to the court. Court questions defendant re: current address & contact information, phone #715-934-9478. Defendant has been Sawyer County resident for 2 years, prior to lived in Washburn for 4 years. Employed at Buchman Lumber for 6 years. 
State makes bond argument, requesting $25,000 cash, with no contact conditions. Atty Mulligan makes bond argument requesting $500 cash. Court sets a $10,000 cash bond w/ conditions. 

Initial Appearance 2/14/2022
